body: This is a bug of the schedule rendering @kaiyingshan. You should notice that the econ discussion is 8 PM and is not 8 AM. Therefore, it is actually very far away from other classes.
Fix at 0f302d72a9f15c9970fb4f6ec49af129efe7ded6.
Fixed at 741b59bfd612767b3595cb318f7a7830b2ba7bc0
The filter is NO CLASS TIME. That is, the time that you DON'T want any classes.

Thanks for the clarificarion.

On Wed, Apr 3, 2019 at 11:05 Hanzhi Zhou <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> The filter is NO CLASS TIME. That is, the time that you DON'T want any
> classes.
>
> —

This is the expected behavior when the internet is slow.
Now it should be better with 213649ea50f70af158148e208bfac5f8f226a37a

We used the `csv-parse` library which is designed for NodeJS, not for the browser. Now I replaced it with `papaparse`, which is faster on the browser. 

Replaced at 0fe3f4c519be2e427e909b38c4972bae8acdf946

Thank Prof. Bloomfield for providing more comprehensive CSVs.
Fixed after a significant rewrote of our fundamental data structure.
Fixed at 0add7e562802943248a5f5fcd7e26081e286796e

First I would like to point out that the loading speed may be quite slow when the traffic is high, due to the fact that the cross-origin proxy may throttle. If Lou's list can enable cross-origin resource sharing, that will be great. 
 
Second, I fixed a small issue at 8a3a428226016362325d511473905354d539259b yesterday. Our program may get stuck in an infinite loop when there're more than 11 distinct classes selected because the color function is unable to probe any available color. Now I incorporated separate chaining to temporarily solve that issue. I'll further refine the automatic color selection algorithm when I have time. (Too much homework not done this week ahhhhh :frowning:). Users will be able to choose colors themselves in the future.
I believe the reason behind it is that you've selected multiple indicators and used the combined sorting mode. Please check.
There are no other indicator, but I checked the time again. It sorting is correct. It is just the display which tricked me.

Color selection feature is mostly stable at 3f336160d9916f9d64aad544db19272fea1d54a3.
CORS origin proxy removed at 23a28a762e2e6c2ead642ef1e426876bc905df23.
Cannot be reproduced.
Well, you're referring to the 11th schedule. Please check the first one.
Should be fixed at 77d0a9e3041e124d463e7152e3cf97ca1cd6463d
BTW mine shows a different result
Oh there is indeed an issue. I'll fix that.

Should be fixed at 9293ccb0e6f44b3ff2d1858c8791434b7697d5c3.

The cause of the problem is that when there is no class during a day, day[0] will evaluate to undefined, and `refTime - undefined` will give NaN.
No Early optimized at fb5e827995544e129ff80679df44fedbdf7211d6
Should alright by now. Issue closed.
Can you give me the class list?
Please give us more details on how this error message appeared, e.g. I changed xxx setting, added xxx class, and clicked the generate button, then this error message appeared.
Fixed. Closed.
Strange error messages usually occur when there is a bug or an unhandled case in our code. We need more information in order to reproduce and address the issue.

This is not a bug. Only the schedules that have an overlap **greater than an hour per day** with the lunch period, defined as the time between 11:00 to 14:00, will be penalized and sorted to the back.
5325032f55e53ef9dd78f71f54246e9c6af6cede

Seem to be a spelling mistake which is fixed at 1896670e7fb3e005018270ec8d0dd57b578975a4
This result is correct and expected. You can calculate the variance manually.
